snippet.title: I Almost Gave Up on Amateur Radio Winter Field Day 2026
snippet.description:
This was my first Amateur Radio Winter Field Day, and I quickly realized I wasn’t prepared for how challenging it would be.

In this video, I operate Winter Field Day 2026 from Texas during rare winter weather, running QRP at 5 watts with the Icom IC-705, and later spending time with the Xiegu G90. Snow, ice, cold temperatures, antenna deployment issues, and logging mistakes turned this into a lesson-heavy experience.

This wasn’t about contest scores or chasing contacts — it was about learning how real-world conditions affect portable amateur radio, especially during a Field Day-style event.

What I cover in this video:

Operating QRP during Winter Field Day

Antenna challenges (EFHW vs dipole)

Logging mistakes I won’t repeat

Why setup efficiency matters more than power

Lessons from my first Winter Field Day as a newer ham

If you’re curious about Winter Field Day, QRP operating, or operating amateur radio in winter conditions, I hope this helps you prepare better than I did.

📡 Callsign: KJ5LXP
❄️ Event: Winter Field Day 2026
📍 Location: Texas
🔋 Power: QRP (5W)
📻 Radios: Icom IC-705, Xiegu G90

📌 Helpful Links & Resources

https://www.icomamerica.com/lineup/am

snippet.title: Little About My College #viralvideo #trending #aviation #mechanic
snippet.description:
✈️ Aviation Technician – Aircraft Maintenance | AME Course in Canada 🇨🇦

In this video, I talk about my Aviation Technician – Aircraft Maintenance program at Mohawk College, Canada.
I explain what this course is about, what aircraft mechanics do, and how the AME (Aircraft Maintenance Engineer) license works in Canada.

You’ll learn about:
 • What an aviation technician / aircraft mechanic does
 • AME license process (total 48 months experience)
 • 18 months credit from college + remaining experience through job
 • Difference between aviation course and pilot career
 • Career scope and salary in Canada

This video is for students from India and abroad who are thinking about aviation, mechanical careers, or studying in Canada.

📌 If you like aviation, engines, and hands-on technical work, this field can be a strong and respected career option.

👉 Drop your questions in the comments
👉 Subscribe for my real aviation journey in Canada ✈️

snippet.title: 3D Print and Build a Handheld HF Radio
snippet.description:
The Contraption is a 3D printed enclosure that turns a QRP radio + batter + antenna into a handheld HF radio.  It's a little ridiculous, but really a lot of fun!

More details: https://www.hamradioduo.com/the-contraption-preview-release-of-3d-print-files/

The files are available now for anyone who wants to try it on their own 3D printer.  We will continue to provide the files for free for those who wish to print their own and will need to supply your own QRP radio, battery, antenna, 3D paddles, and cables.

Disclaimer: please enjoy this project at your own risk.  Mike broke his favorite paddle already.  Due to the nature of it, it is possible if not even likely that you drop something and break it.  Also, as always use caution when playing radio outside – don't walk in front of cars when pedestrian mobile, always be cautious of power lines, etc.

73,
Michael N4FFF es Becky N4BKY

🛒 HamRadioDuo Shop: https://shop.hamradioduo.com/

snippet.title: Saudi Commission SCFHS License Test Passed in 1st Attempt #scfhs #saudijobs #ytshorts #shorts
snippet.description:
🎉 Congratulations Dr. Adnan! 🎉

Heartiest congratulations to Dr. Adnan on successfully passing the SCFHS License Test and achieving a major career milestone 👏

✨ From Technician to Specialist Rank! ✨
Dr. Adnan initially obtained his Technician rank, and with dedication, hard work, and the right preparation, he has now upgraded his rank to Specialist after clearing the SCFHS exam. He is Practicing in Saudi Arabia. This journey is a true inspiration for all healthcare professionals aiming to grow in Saudi Arabia 🇸🇦

📚 Preparation Success
Dr. Adnan prepared using the exam-oriented material provided by Dr. Noman Ghaffar Awan, which played a key role in his success. Proper guidance + smart preparation = guaranteed results ✅

👉 If you are planning to appear in the SCFHS License Exam and want authentic, updated, and result-oriented preparation material, feel free to contact:

📞 WhatsApp Contact: +92 300 8881254

🚀 Upgrade your rank, secure your future, and move one step closer to your professional goals.
Once again, many congratulations Dr. Adnan — wishing you continued success ahead! 🌟

snippet.title: [Review] The Ham Radio Prep Technician Class License Manual (Ham Radio Prep) Summarized
snippet.description:
The Ham Radio Prep Technician Class License Manual (Ham Radio Prep)

- Amazon USA Store: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0BGXYDB1P?tag=9natree-20
- Amazon Worldwide Store: https://global.buys.trade/The-Ham-Radio-Prep-Technician-Class-License-Manual-Ham-Radio-Prep.html

- eBay: https://www.ebay.com/sch/i.html?_nkw=The+Ham+Radio+Prep+Technician+Class+License+Manual+Ham+Radio+Prep+&mkcid=1&mkrid=711-53200-19255-0&siteid=0&campid=5339060787&customid=9natree&toolid=10001&mkevt=1

- Read more: https://mybook.top/read/B0BGXYDB1P/

#TechnicianClassexam #hamradiolicensing #FCCrules #VHFUHFoperating #radiotheorybasics #TheHamRadioPrepTechnicianClassLicenseManual

These are takeaways from this book.

Firstly, Exam focused learning aligned to the 2022 to 2026 question pool, A central value of a Technician Class manual tied to a specific exam cycle is alignment. The FCC Technician exam is based on a published question pool that changes on a scheduled timeline, and study materials that match that pool help learners spend time on what will actually be tested. This book is positioned to track the 2022 to 2026 pool, which means its content selection and organization are likely designed to mirror the knowledge areas and the exam style that candidates will face. Readers benefit from seeing concepts in the same framing they will encounter on test day, including definitions, typical calculations, and common rule based scenarios. An exam focused approach also helps reduce cognitive overload for beginners by prioritizing foundational concepts first, then layering in more technical details only where necessary. This can be especially important for those new to electronics, radio frequency behavior, or regulatory language. When a guide is structured around the question pool, it encourages efficient repetition, targeted review, and measurable progress. Used well, this approach supports both passing the exam and understanding why the correct answers make sense, so the knowledge carries over into safe and effective operating.

Secondly, FCC rules, licensing structure, and operator responsibilities, Technician Class candidates must understand the regulatory environment that governs amateur radio in the United States. A strong manual translates rules into practical decision making: what you may transmit, where you may transmit, and how to identify correctly while operating. Expect attention to the role of the FCC, the purpose of the amateur service, and the different license classes, with emphasis on the privileges and limitations of the Technician license. A key learning goal is operator responsibility, because compliance is not only about passing a test, it is about building habits that prevent interference, unsafe practices, and enforcement problems. Topics in this area commonly include station identification, control operator duties, permissible communications, third party traffic basics, and how band plans and frequency allocations relate to legal authority. Many new operators also need clarity on what is allowed when using repeaters, digital modes, or satellite operations, and how to choose frequencies that are appropriate for their privileges. By connecting rules to real operating examples, the book can help readers become confident, conscientious operators who understand the difference between good etiquette and actual legal requirements. This foundation supports safer operation and smoother integration into local radio communities.

Thirdly, Radio and electronics fundamentals for practical comprehension, The Technician exam includes core concepts from basic electronics and radio theory, and beginners often struggle when materials become overly abstract. A prep oriented manual usually focuses on the practical minimum needed to interpret questions and operate equipment wisely. This includes understanding voltage, current, resistance, and power, along with common component behavior such as resistors, capacitors, and inductors. It also typically covers DC versus AC, series and parallel circuits, basic use cases for fuses and protective devices, and why grounding and proper wiring matter. On the radio side, candidates need the vocabulary of frequency, wavelength, modulation, bandwidth, and signal behavior, including how antennas and feed lines affect performance. Even a simplified approach can still teach valuable intuition: higher frequency generally means shorter wavelength, line loss increases with frequency, and improper connections can create high standing wave ratio and inefficient transmission. By tying fundamentals to scenarios such as choosing a power supply, understanding what an SWR meter indicates, or recognizing why a signal is distorted, the book can help learners move beyond memorization. The outcome is a reader who can answer exam questions and also make informed decisions when setting up a first station.

Fourthly, Operating practices, repeaters, and real world on air skills, Earning a license is only the first step

snippet.title: Ham Radio Technician License FAST TRACK | Get On The Air Quickly
snippet.description:
Want to get on the air fast? This video walks you through the Ham Radio Technician License using a focused, beginner-friendly fast track approach.

We cover what you actually need to know for the exam, how to study efficiently, and how amateur radio plays a critical role in preparedness, emergency communications, and resilient communities.

Ham radio isn’t just a hobby, it’s a skill for uncertain times. Whether you’re interested in emergency preparedness, local communication, or learning a powerful technical skill, this is where it starts.

The Informed Republic Project promotes education, preparedness, and community resilience through responsible information and practical resources.

• Step-by-step certification & contractor licensing process (applications, fees, testing, and approvals)
• Key 2026 NEC code changes impacting your exam and field work  (including GFCI/AFCI updates, grounding & bonding, EV charging, service disconnects, and safety requirements)
• Proven tips for passing California electrician and C-10 contractor exams and planning your long-term career

Whether you’re pursuing state electrician certification, upgrading your classification, or preparing to obtain your California C-10 Electrical Contractor license, this guide gives you clear, actionable steps and official guidance to stay compliant and pass your exam.

Who is this video for?
✔ Aspiring electricians pursuing California certification

✔ Anyone navigating California’s electrician or contractor licensing process

snippet.title: The Best Mobile Ham Radios Under £500
snippet.description:
How much do you really need to spend to go mobile on ham radio?

In this video, we take a look at some of the best-value mobile ham radios, all priced to get you on the air without overspending.

We cover a range of VHF, UHF and HF mobile radios, including both used and current models, and explain what each one is best suited for. Whether you’re installing your first mobile rig, upgrading from a handheld, or looking for a good-value HF option, this video gives a clear, realistic overview of what’s available at different price points.

All radios featured have been fully checked and offer strong value for money. Availability on used equipment is limited and changes quickly.

snippet.title: LIVE: Emergency Action Messages Alert! Ham Radio Monitoring WW3 Tensions & IRAN Crisis on Icom
snippet.description:
Join us live from our ham radio shack in Lower New York as we fire up the Icom IC-7300 to scan and attempt to understand real-time Emergency Action Messages (EAMs) amid escalating global hotspots. With U.S.-Iran tensions boiling over—UN Security Council warnings, alleged U.S. boat strikes on drug networks, and Maduro's military buildup—we're tuning into potential WW3 signals. Expect live frequency sweeps on HF bands, signal analysis, and updates on Guyana border disputes, Russian alliances, and broader Middle East ripple effects. Whether you're a fellow radio enthusiast or prepping for uncertainty, this is your front-row seat to the airwaves. QSL if you copy!

Drop your callsign in chat, share your scans, and let's monitor together. Gear: Icom IC-7300, dipole antenna optimized for 3-30 MHz. Stay tuned—signals don't wait!


#ww3
#iran 
#israel 
#thursday
#gold 
#nuclear 
#Trump




#HamRadio #IC7300 #EAM #EmergencyActionMessages #WW3 #VenezuelaCrisis #Geopolitics #RadioMonitoring #Prepper #Shortwave #LiveStream #AmateurRadio #HFListening #Maduro #USVenezuelaTensions1.7sFast

localized.title: LIVE: Emergency Action Messages Alert! Ham Radio Monitoring WW3 Tensions & IRAN Crisis on Icom
localized.description:
Join us live from our ham radio shack in Lower New York as we fire up the Icom IC-7300 to scan and attempt to understand real-time Emergency Action Messages (EAMs) amid escalating global hotspots. With U.S.-Iran tensions boiling over—UN Security Council warnings, alleged U.S. boat strikes on drug networks, and Maduro's military buildup—we're tuning into potential WW3 signals. Expect live frequency sweeps on HF bands, signal analysis, and updates on Guyana border disputes, Russian alliances, and broader Middle East ripple effects. Whether you're a fellow radio enthusiast or prepping for uncertainty, this is your front-row seat to the airwaves. QSL if you copy!

Drop your callsign in chat, share your scans, and let's monitor together. Gear: Icom IC-7300, dipole antenna optimized for 3-30 MHz. Stay tuned—signals don't wait!


#ww3
#iran 
#israel 
#thursday
#gold 
#nuclear 
#Trump




#HamRadio #IC7300 #EAM #EmergencyActionMessages #WW3 #VenezuelaCrisis #Geopolitics #RadioMonitoring #Prepper #Shortwave #LiveStream #AmateurRadio #HFListening #Maduro #USVenezuelaTensions1.7sFast

snippet.title: Ham Radio's Biggest Problem Right Now
snippet.description:
Is Ham radio truly welcoming to newcomers and fresh ideas, or does gatekeeping and resistance to change hold the hobby back? In this video, we dive deep into the real experiences of new hams in 2026—exploring everything from friendly "Elmer" mentors who guide beginners, to stories of grumpy old-timers, club snobbery, and unwelcoming attitudes on repeaters and forums.

Whether you're thinking about getting your Technician license, already a new ham feeling intimidated, or a longtime operator wondering how to make the hobby more inclusive—this honest discussion uncovers the good, the bad, and the hopeful side of amateur radio today.
If you're new to ham radio, curious about the community drama, or passionate about keeping the hobby alive for future generations, hit play and join the conversation!

snippet.title: Любительская радиосвязь в США
snippet.description:
Tаймкоды:

00:00 - 01:45 - введение
01:45 - 06:34 - получение лицензии
06:34 - 10:12 - типы радиосвязи
10:12 - 17:35 - любительские частоты
17:35 - 23:58 - приложения
23:58 - 41:03 - радио соревнования
41:03 - 44:49 - Parks on The Air (парки в эфире)

Полезные ссылки:

https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-47/chapter-I/subchapter-D/part-97 - федеральный закон о любительском радио

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rDHVz55gFuk - видео с подробной пошаговой инструкцией получения лицензии радиолюбителя в США

https://www.arrl.org - сайт американской лиги радиолюбителей

https://www.n1fd.org - сайт радиоклуба в городе Нэшуа, штат Нью-Гэмпшир

https://www.amazon.com/Technician-Element-Amateur-Preparation-2022-2026/dp/1625951906/ref=sr_1_12?crid=384B2OKF5A0SH&dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.a-PN4cpQ1nYSlasnjGaKFKyFBMNI2lEjzIDTg52EZSFwdLhU2L6oxkoJxV8Qm5MvwEcyc_-2sPkbnLbv1-Jsw7ijqx2V_Vho3hE7dVb5ax96IgI97r9Kk3aWOkqO8S3AMjzxhdOeZd3TIUuf8iS3UFdvpv_v10LGYFD3u2ifN5phK8tiRCmXWGto2viBgz1hH-9thOhSkJ49mWt7f1ypiM1kNqn2sZh4igHXwzHYVCo.WINXuo6PbUxM2TBLJ2cOM5PvLrxBA8aTWSlMNJawKgI&dib_tag=se&keywords=technician+ham+radio+study+book&qid=1769912352&sprefix=technitian+ham+%2Caps%2C429&sr=8-12 - учебник для подготовки к экзамену

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ZcpV2IOuyFPX-GRISUeNT9FzuIC_Eq8y/view?usp=sharing - ссылка на схему с частотами (pdf файл)

https://hamstudy.org/tech2022 - сайт где можно самостоятельно подготовиться к экзамену

https://pota.app/#/ - сайт Parks on The Air

https://www.youtube.com/@HamRadioCrashCourse - один из лучших каналов о любительском радио на английском

В видео показано радио Baofeng GT-5R

snippet.title: Electrical and RF Safety: Ham Radio General License Prep Sub Element 10 Valid until June 30, 2027)
snippet.description:
Welcome to the General Class License Test Prep series! This video covers electrical and RF safety, emphasizing its importance for amateur radio operators. We discuss critical safety awareness and how to avoid electrical hazards to ensure safe radio operation. Understanding rf exposure is key for ham radio safety and transmitting signals without causing harm. 

Checkout hamstudy.org to get started!

If you're just starting out, you need to start with the Technician License.  Here is the playlist! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DdzQS10JnHU&list=PL1KAjn5rGhixvvb_jMZFWmbP97-t9Kyxk

snippet.title: SOTA Activations (February 1, 2020) #sota #hamradio #winter #snow
snippet.description:
#sota #hamradio #winter #snow 

This short video features snapshots from three SOTA (Summits On The Air) activations that W4KWM and I performed on February 1, 2020.  Because of winter bonus points, we earned a total of 25 points toward the 1,000 points to reach Mountain Goat status. 

Toxaway Mountain in North Carolina, (W4C/WM-047) at 4,777 feet above sea level, was first, for 11 points, including 3 bonus points.  Next was Burnt Mountain in South Carolina (W4C/CM-147) at 3,340 feet ASL, for 7 total points, including the Winter bonus.  Finally, we activated Sassafras Mountain in South Carolina (W4C/US-001) at 3,553 feet ASL, for another for 7 total points, including the Winter bonus.  25 points in one day is pretty good.  

We previously activated this same trio in February of 2019.  But the first attempt to activate Toxaway Mountain, on December 8, 2018, failed. My truck started sliding off the single lane mountain road as we closed to within a mile of the summit. We turned back to keep from sliding off the mountain.  In 2019 and 2020 we used W4KWM’s 4-wheel-drive Toyota Tundra, which we affectionately call “Rusty” the trusty SOTA mobile.  Rusty got us there but Wayne still had to get a running start and main forward momentum in order not to get stuck.

I hope you enjoy this video and find it helpful.  If you find my channel informative and entertaining, I hope you will consider joining my support group by clicking on: www.patreon.com/N4HNH There are 3 levels of support, including exclusive content.  Visibility of premium content is determined by the level of membership you choose. The higher the membership level, the more content you have access to. Annual S9 (VIP) members have full access to all content, and they can request personal, one-on-one, consultation. 

Many videos are visible to the Patreon team members long before they are released for public viewing. Some videos are never released for public viewing. 

Annual S9 (VIP) members have access to the menu optimization PDFs I’ve written for the FT-891, FT-991A, FTdx5000MP, FTdx101D/MP, FTdx10, or FT-710 AESS.  Future radios could be added. There are also FT8 guides available.  These documents are exclusively available for S9 (VIP) members who subscribe annually. The documents are copyrighted. They shall not be divulged to anyone else without the written permission of Douglas McAlexander, callsign N4HNH.

N4HNH Radio has a Web site where you can purchase T-shirts with some of the sayings you might hear in the videos.  Some of the more prominent videos are featured there as well as a page geared toward ham radio training.  Go to: https://www.n4hnhradio.com

Another great way to help support this channel is to click like and subscribe.

73, de N4HNH

snippet.title: POTA Isn’t What You Think — 5 Myths We’re Killing Today
snippet.description:
Parks on the Air (POTA) is supposed to be fun… but myths and bad advice stop a LOT of hams from ever activating.

In this episode, we break down the Top 5 most common POTA myths — and explain why they’re flat-out wrong.

We cover things like:

❌ “You need a perfect setup before you activate”

❌ “You need high power to be successful”

❌ “You need expensive gear”

❌ “If you don’t get a pileup, you’re doing it wrong”

❌ “You have to be an expert to activate POTA”

Spoiler: None of that is true.

POTA rewards getting on the air, not perfection.
Low power works. Simple antennas work. Used gear works.
And no — you don’t need to be an expert to start.

If your radio turns on, your antenna is up, and you’re calling CQ — you’re doing it right.

👇 Drop a comment and tell us:

Which myth held you back the longest?

Or which one you still hear all the time?

📡 Subscribe for more real-world POTA, portable radio, and ham radio talk
🍺 Join us live on Brew & Activate for more myth-busting and field wisdom

snippet.title: QRP CW DX from a Summit! |  SKCC Contact with Japan
snippet.description:
Operating QRP from a mountain summit never gets old — especially when CW carries all the way to Japan. In this activation, I set up a lightweight QRP station under a tarp, running CW for Summits on the Air (SOTA) and Straight Key Century Club (SKCC).
I’ve been trying for months to make a Straight Key Century Club (SKCC) contact from a summit, and this activation finally made it happen. The QSO was completed with Take, JR2IUB, on 15 meters, proving once again what’s possible with low power, patience, and good propagation.

The contact was made using:
Elecraft KX2 running 5 watts QRP
A newly built dual-core OCF dipole
A 1939 8-AMP straight key
This activation is a perfect example of why I love portable CW — simple gear, historic hardware, and real DX from a remote summit.

🎙️ Mode: CW
⛰️ Program: Summits on the Air (SOTA)
🔑 Club: SKCC
📡 Power: QRP (5W)
🌏 DX: Japan (JR2IUB)
🎒 Portable summit station

If you enjoy QRP CW, SOTA activations, or straight key operating, this one’s for you.

👍 Like
💬 Comment
📡 Subscribe for more CW, QRP, and SOTA content
🏔️🌍 #SOTA #POTA  #qrp  #cw 
72 Dugbo D7DUG

snippet.title: Best Meshtastic Devices for Beginners (2026 Off Grid Comms Starter Guide)
snippet.description:
Meshtastic is one of the easiest and most powerful ways to build off grid communication using long range LoRa radios.

In this video, I’m giving you my best beginner friendly recommendations for getting started at any skill level.

I go over my top device picks, from simple ready to go options to full DIY builds, and I walk you through how approachable this really is.

We also get creative with DIY, including simple ways to build your own cases using everyday packaging and materials, so anyone can jump in without spending a fortune.

The goal is simple
Build the mesh
Connect more people worldwide
Bring back real self reliance through independent communication

Because you don’t know how much time we have until the systems and networks we rely on every day cut out.

Start small. Bring one node online. Every device makes the network stronger.

Welcome to Meshtastic.

snippet.title: Antennas and Feedlines: Ham Radio General License Prep Sub Element 9 (Valid until June 30, 2027)
snippet.description:
We are continuing through the general class license question pool, focusing on antennas and feed lines. This video covers essential information for your general ham radio license exam, making complex topics like antenna theory and antenna basics easier to understand. Join us as we explore the fundamental principles of radio and how antennas operate, ensuring you're well-prepared.
Checkout hamstudy.org to get started!

If you're just starting out, you need to start with the Technician License.  Here is the playlist! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DdzQS10JnHU&list=PL1KAjn5rGhixvvb_jMZFWmbP97-t9Kyxk
